title: `cquery --output=proto --transitions=lite 'deps(//...)'` crashes with `bufferSize must be >= 0`
body:
### Description of the bug:


On a large bazel project, running `bazel cquery --output=proto --transitions=lite 'deps(//...)' >/dev/null` fails like this:

```
INFO: Analyzed 252216 targets (2000 packages loaded, 534000 targets configured).
 no actions running
INFO: Found 252216 targets...
FATAL: bazel crashed due to an internal error. Printing stack trace:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: bufferSize must be >= 0
	at com.google.protobuf.CodedOutputStream$AbstractBufferedEncoder.<init>(CodedOutputStream.java:2229)
	at com.google.protobuf.CodedOutputStream$OutputStreamEncoder.<init>(CodedOutputStream.java:2699)
	at com.google.protobuf.CodedOutputStream.newInstance(CodedOutputStream.java:85)
	at com.google.protobuf.AbstractMessageLite.writeTo(AbstractMessageLite.java:60)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.query2.cquery.ProtoOutputFormatterCallback.writeData(ProtoOutputFormatterCallback.java:245)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.query2.cquery.ProtoOutputFormatterCallback.close(ProtoOutputFormatterCallback.java:219)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.PostAnalysisQueryProcessor.doPostAnalysisQuery(PostAnalysisQueryProcessor.java:220)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.PostAnalysisQueryProcessor.process(PostAnalysisQueryProcessor.java:95)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.BuildTool.buildTargetsWithoutMergedAnalysisExecution(BuildTool.java:373)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.BuildTool.buildTargets(BuildTool.java:254)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.BuildTool.processRequest(BuildTool.java:722)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.buildtool.BuildTool.processRequest(BuildTool.java:690)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.runtime.commands.CqueryCommand.exec(CqueryCommand.java:188)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.runtime.BlazeCommandDispatcher.execExclusively(BlazeCommandDispatcher.java:681)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.runtime.BlazeCommandDispatcher.exec(BlazeCommandDispatcher.java:253)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.server.GrpcServerImpl.executeCommand(GrpcServerImpl.java:607)
	at com.google.devtools.build.lib.server.GrpcServerImpl.lambda$run$0(GrpcServerImpl.java:677)
	at io.grpc.Context$1.run(Context.java:566)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
```

This query is what https://github.com/bazel-contrib/target-determinator calls internally.
Using `--output_file` instead of STDOUT causes the same problem.

### Which category does this issue belong to?

Core

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


There's no easy way to reproduce, this error was triggered when doing load-testing on our company's internal monorepo by adding 2000 more services to it. Please let me know if you absolutely need a reproduction case, I can maybe try to create something minimal.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


macOS

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 8.3.1
